dialogues.text: Abe is taking his customary Sunday morning walk with Mend the traffic sparse, the sun blazing, they wear dark lightweight suits. Abe has his yarmulke, Mendel sports a straw hat.

dialogues.speaker: MENDEL
dialogues.text: So has he got it? or has he ain’t?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: He’s got it.

dialogues.speaker: MENDEL
dialogues.text: You mean you really have a stomach for this all over again?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Granted I counted twelve heads in a union hall last night, it made me nauseous.

dialogues.speaker: MENDEL
dialogues.text: From little acorns, Mammoths grow.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: The man doesn’t get distouraged, he’s got a nice smile and no longer does he linger over the pig’s feet in the bodegas. Mendel sighs.

dialogues.speaker: MENDEL
dialogues.text: I see the bug’s bit you good.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: And a few others. They’re signing on. They asked him to speak at the firehouse tonight, tomorrow the Catholic high school, even the right wingers are taking a shine.to him -- MENDEL . . My boy, you’ve hooked your wagon t a star.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Star, schmar -- in a city where there are no men, he strives to be a man. Silence, they walk on.  x

dialogues.speaker: MENDEL
dialogues.text: No small thing.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: No, no small thing. PULL BACK, FARTHER and FARTHER, they are two black dots n on the bridge, PAN UP, in the distance the gold dome of C Hall gleams.
